content:
Branching off @Abigail Watson in the "Self-Tracking Worksheet" thread -

Kvetch: I wish we could spend Thursday conference call meetings talking about topics like this, instead of rehashing the charter (yet again).

Who says we can't? (Honest question) If we suspended everything else, who would complain? These are emergency times, as @Virginia Lorenzi related from her front-line experience at NY Presbyterian. Nurses working without masks??? OMG!

Also, I imagine we're free to create an alternate call for anyone who wants to spend an hour on that instead of the usual one. Thank you for speaking up.

BUT - if the same thing is being discussed elsewhere (which I'm sure is true), what's distinctive about Patient Empowerment WG in COVID-19? Would we be better off going and being ambassadors into those discussions?
No-one's going to slap our hands for not getting the SWOT done in the next month or two. (In fact, the next hand-slapping opportunity won't even roll around until September :) )
